name: methyl_salicylate
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.

name: methyl_salicylate
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: The basic unit for methyl salicylate is benzene which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The following functional group adjustments are applied: Hydroxy group: -40°C (hydrogen bonding and increased polarity generally lower the melting point), Ester group (combination of acyl and alkoxy): +25°C (esterification generally increases melting point due to dipole-dipole interactions), 1,3-disubstitution pattern on benzene: -3°C (provides slight steric hindrance which can disrupt the crystal lattice, thus slightly lowering the melting point).
